document.forum_title: WDEL 1150AM & WDEL.com ~ Dependable News, Delaware's Views
document.discussion_title: Milton's run in Little League regional stopped by Pennsylvania
document.topic_text: Milton's run in Little League regional stopped by Pennsylvania By Sean Greene 12:20am, August 12, 2016 Milton's Chase Boyle smashed a three-run homer, but the Delaware Little League champions were eliminated from Mid-Atlantic Regional play with a 9-5 loss to the Pennsylvania state champions Thursday night. Delaware fell behind 1-0 in the top of the first, but responded in kind when Brian Sponaugle's single to right scored Aidan Major to tie the game. Keystone (Pennsylvania) then jumped ahead 5-1 in the third after three Delaware errors, but after Hunter Rauch singled and Tyler Husbands walked to lead off the 3rd inning, they could trot home on Boyle's blast to left field that brought Delaware within a run. The rally continued after a 2-plus hour lightning and rain delay, but they could not get the tying run. Pennsylvania steadily pulled away, getting a run in the 4th, and then three more in the 6th inning, including a two-run shot by Kaden Falls. Boyle added his 4th RBI in the game with a 2-out bases loaded walk in the 6th inning that allowed the tying run to come to the plate, but a strikeout ended Delaware's hopes for a 3rd trip to Williamsport in state history. Brian Sponaugle went 2-for-4 with the RBI for Milton, who also picked up hits from Timothy Hitchcock and Paris Mitchell. Copyright © Aug 12,
